humanum_full_description_en:
There are two theories about the structure of Jia Jinwen, one is like the shape of a fetus (Tadazu Takada). One talk about the shape of a snake and insect. "Shuowen": "Bao, the elephant is pregnant, and the elephant is in the middle. The elephant is not formed." "Shuowen": "Si, Si Ye. In April, the yang qi is released, the yin qi is hidden, and everything is visible. , Into a text, so it is a snake, pictogram. All the genus of Si are from Si." " Si " and " zi " are borrowed as twelve earthly branches (sixth and first).

The Jia Jin inscription " Si " is also the province of " sacrifice ". It is used for " sacrifice ", and Wu Wangjian: "Work (attack) Wu Wangzha (for) Yuansi (sa)". In addition to being used as " sacrifice ", there are five usages in bronze inscriptions: 1. It is used as the name of the earthly branch, and it is used as the name of the land branch. Second, it means termination. The classics are called " Already ", Xu Zizhong: "Mei Shoumu (Wu) Si (Already)". Third, used as the first interjection of the sentence, Yu Ding: "SiÔπó Nv (Ru) Mei Chenyou (you) Dafu." "Shang Shu. "Daguo": "To the only boy." The biography of Kong Anguo: "Si, the beginning of a sigh." Fourth, used as a sentence at the end of the sentence, the classics are " have ", Wu Wangguangjian: "Wang Si (Already) Hang ( Uncle Ji, reverence is the queen." Five, "Sisi" means "Yiyue" and "Yiyi" in the classics. "The Analects. "Zilu": "Friends cut Sisao, brother Yiyi." Ma Rong's note: "Yiyi, Heshun look."

"Shuowen": "Bao, the elephant is pregnant, and the elephant is in the middle. The elephant is not formed." "Shuowen": "Si, Si Ye. In April, the yang qi is released, the yin qi is hidden, and everything is visible. , Into a text, so it is a snake, pictogram. All the genus of Si are from Si." " Si" and " zi" are borrowed as twelve earthly branches (sixth and first). The Jia Jin inscription " Si" is also the province of " sacrifice". It is used for " sacrifice", and Wu Wangjian: "Work (attack) Wu Wangzha (for) Yuansi (sa)". In addition to being used as " sacrifice", there are five usages in bronze inscriptions: 1. It is used as the name of the earthly branch, and it is used as the name of the land branch. Second, it means termination. The classics are called " Already", Xu Zizhong: "Mei Shoumu (Wu) Si (Already)". Third, used as the first interjection of the sentence, Yu Ding: "SiÔπó Nv (Ru) Mei Chenyou (you) Dafu." "Shang Shu. "Daguo": "To the only boy." The biography of Kong Anguo: "Si, the beginning of a sigh." Fourth, used as a sentence at the end of the sentence, the classics are " have", Wu Wangguangjian: "Wang Si (Already) Hang ( Uncle Ji, reverence is the queen." Si
Basic explanation of words
Si
s√¨
The sixth place in the earthly branch belongs to the snake.
Used for timing: Si Shi (9 o'clock to 11 o'clock in the morning).
Si
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[‚ë†]Ôºªs√¨ÔºΩ
(1) The sixth place of the Earthly Branch. Matches the heavenly stems to record the year.
(2) The sixth place of the Earthly Branch. It is used to record the month, which is the fourth month of the lunar calendar.
(3) The sixth place of the Earthly Branch. Used to record the day.
(4) The sixth place of the earthly branches. It is used to record the hour, that is, from 9 am to 11 am.
(5) The zodiac signs are used as snakes; the five elements are used with fire.
(6) The provincial name of the Shangsi Festival.
(7) Since.
